trans-unit.source: Indicates that an error occurred while negotiating the security context for a message.
This exception can happen in the following cases:
While negotiating the initial security context.
The exact error depends on the negotiation technology used: either [Simple and Protected GSS-API Negotiation (SPNEGO)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96699) or TLSNEGO.
While establishing a security session on top of an initial security context.
During key renewal for an existing security session.
Security negotiation errors can occur as part of the *Spnego*/*Sslnego* security protocol or as part of the SecureConversation protocol.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityNegotiationException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityNegotiationException"></xref> class with a specified error message.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityNegotiationException"></xref> class with serialization information and streaming context specified.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that contains all the data required to serialize the exception.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that specifies the source and destination of the stream.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityNegotiationException"></xref> class with serialization information and inner exception specified.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that caused the current exception to be thrown.
